title: Eisenhower National Historic Site: Field Trips
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Education     Parks as Classrooms     Field Trips                 Education Field Trip Programs                               Â    Eisenhower National Historic Site offers a variety of education field trip programs for grades 3 to 12. Reservations may be made by submitting via postal or e-mail the RESERVATION REQUEST FORM. All fees are waived for classes attending any of the programs. Please contact us at gett__education@nps.gov or call (717) 338-4422 with any questions.  The Molding of a Leader: Leadership and Dwight D. Eisenhower A character education program focusing on Eisenhower's leadership ability as Supreme Commander and President. Grades 3 - 5. more... Agricultural Science and Environmental Education: Field Studies at the Eisenhower Farm Programs on Soil, Water, Wildlife, and Forestry offering students the opportunity to learn about the environment through real science in the field. Grades 5 to 12.more... Ike and the Men of D-Day Students examine how the American infantry soldiers were prepared and equipped for the biggest military undertaking of WWII. Grades 3 to 12. more... Eisenhower, A Five Star American Students learn how Eisenhower's leadership skills developed during his early years and then see those skills in action as they take part in a presidential press conference. Grades 5 to 8. more... Thaw in the Cold War: Eisenhower and Khrushchev at Gettysburg For classes working on the A Teaching with Historic Places Lesson Plan - Thaw in the Cold War, we can enhance your visit to the site with a curriculum based tour. more... DON'T HAVE TIME OR FUNDING FOR A FIELD TRIP? CHECK OUT OUR VIRTUAL ASK A RANGER PROGRAM.
